intro: Lastrea divergens, commonly known as the divergent lastrea, is a species of succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as thick cuticles and succulent leaves to store water. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in collections of succulents.
